Uses of Class
eu.iv4xr.framework.extensions.ltl.LTL

Packages that use LTL
Package
Description
eu.iv4xr.framework.extensions.ltl
This package provides the following features: The classes LTL and BoundedLTL implementing Linear Temporal Logic formulas, and the bounded variation of them.
eu.iv4xr.framework.mainConcepts

    LTL.WeakUntil<State>
    Weak-until is not primitive in LTL-sense, but we add it as a separate class so that we can structurally recognize that a formula is a weak-until formula.

    Methods in eu.iv4xr.framework.extensions.ltl that return LTL
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static <State> LTL<State>
    LTL.always​(LTL<State> phi)
    always(phi) constructs the LTL formula "G phi" (also written "[] phi").
    static <State> LTL<State>
    LTL.always​(Predicate<State> phi)
    If p is a state-predicate, always(phi) constructs the LTL formula "G now(p)" (also written "[] now(p)").
    static <State> LTL<State>

    LTL.implies​(LTL<State> psi)
    phi.implies(psi) constructs the LTL formula "phi --> psi".
    static <State> LTL<State>
    LTL2Buchi.isNotPhi​(LTL<State> phi)
    To recognize and destruct "not(phi)" pattern, where phi is non-atomic.
    static <State> LTL<State>
    LTL2Buchi.pushNegations​(LTL<State> f)
    Normalize an LTL formula by rewriting it, so that negations are recursively pushed as far as possible inside.

    BuchiModelChecker.find​(LTL<IExplorableState> phi, int maxDepth)
    The same as BuchiModelChecker.find(Buchi, int), but it takes an LTL formula for specifying the pattern of the execution to find.
    BasicModelChecker.Path<Pair<IExplorableState,​String>>
    BuchiModelChecker.findShortest​(LTL<IExplorableState> phi, int maxDepth)
    Similar to BuchiModelChecker.find(LTL, int), but it will return the shortest execution (of the specified max-length) that satisfies the given LTL.

    LTL.next​(LTL<State> phi)
    If p is a state-predicate, next(p) constructs the LTL formula "X now(p)".
    static <State> LTL<State>
    LTL2Buchi.pushNegations​(LTL<State> f)
    Normalize an LTL formula by rewriting it, so that negations are recursively pushed as far as possible inside.
    SATVerdict

    Check if the target 'program' BuchiModelChecker.model can produce an infinite execution that would satisfy the given LTL formula.
    SATVerdict
    BuchiModelChecker.sat​(LTL<IExplorableState> phi, int maxDepth)
